metadata.title: CVE-2016-6624 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in phpMyAdmin involving improper enforcement of theIP-based authentication rules. When phpMyAdmin is used with IPv6 in a proxyserver environment, and the proxy server is in the allowed range but theattacking computer is not allowed, this vulnerability can allow theattacking computer to connect despite the IP rules. All 4.6.x versions(prior to 4.6.4), 4.4.x versions (prior to 4.4.15.8), and 4.0.x versions(prior to 4.0.10.17) are affected.

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
